DOC.brief_title: Effects Oral Protein Load Kidney Function Patients Undergoing Cardiac Surgery
DOC.detailed_description: Acute kidney injury ( AKI ) occur approximately one-third patient undergo cardiac surgery ( CS ) , represent one significant negative predictor patient outcome population . To date , therapy prevent AKI . In healthy adult , high protein meal know enhance glomerular filtration rate ( GFR ) mediate increase renal blood flow . The investigator hypothesize preoperative oral protein load may induce adaptive response kidney , precondition kidney upcoming insult . In present study , investigator aim compare prevalence severity AKI patient undergo oral high protein load age- gender-matched `` control '' receive protein load cardiac surgery within period ( October 2014-November 2015 ) San Bortolo Hospital , Vicenza , Italy .
DOC.criteria: 1 . Subjects older 18 year 2 . Subjects undergo elective cardiac surgery 1 . Pregnancy 2 . Chronic kidney disease â‰¥ stage III 3 . Solitary kidney 4 . Diabetes mellitus type 1 5 . Recent cardiac arrest 6 . Liver failure cirrhosis 7 . Total parenteral nutrition 8 . Hemoglobin < 11 g/dl 9 . Sepsis 10 . History malabsorption , chronic inflammatory bowel disease , short bowel , pancreatic insufficiency 11 . Transplant donor recipient 12 . Active autoimmune disease renal involvement 13 .
